meanings.definition: To boast or brag more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: She always tries to outbrag her friends about her accomplishments.
meanings.sent2: He tends to outbrag others when talking about his achievements.
meanings.sent3: At the party, everyone laughed when she tried to outbrag the guest of honor.
meanings.sent4: In the world of sales, it's a constant battle to outbrag the competition.
meanings.sent5: The politician's attempt to outbrag his opponent backfired spectacularly.

meanings.definition: To surpass in bragging or boasting.
meanings.sent1: Despite his efforts, he could never outbrag his older brother.
meanings.sent2: She managed to outbrag all her colleagues with her stories of adventure.
meanings.sent3: The two friends playfully tried to outbrag each other about their video game skills.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to outbrag even the most confident individuals was truly impressive.
meanings.sent5: The team captain always found a way to outbrag his opponents before a match.
